intro: Celsia heterophylla, commonly known as the variable celsia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in regions of Argentina and Chile. The plant is characterized by its variable leaf morphology, with leaves that can be either basal or alternate depending on the growth conditions. It produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically yellow or white in color. Celsia heterophylla is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
